snippet: In a study of insurance claims, forward-collision warning systems appeared to lower the risk of a crash, while lane-departure warnings appeared to marginally raise the risk of an accident.
abstract: In a study of insurance claims, forward-collision warning systems appeared to lower the risk of a crash, while lane-departure warnings appeared to marginally raise the risk of an accident.

headline.main: Analysis Suggests Some Collision-Warning Systems May Be Ineffective
